alert.note: Alert for Pinellas (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued January 15 at 10:10AM EST until January 18 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM EST SUNDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SUNDAY TO 8 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, Minor to moderate coastal flooding is expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 9 feet. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents are expected. * WHERE...Pinellas County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 7 PM this evening to 7 PM EST Sunday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 3 AM Sunday to 8 PM EST Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, from this evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Water levels are expected to run 2 to 4 feet above normal tide level especially at times of high tide tonight and again on Sunday. Some roads along the coast could flood. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may experience flooding. Water overtopping seawalls will be possible. Some shoreline erosion will occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion is expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
